1102738832846397440.text:
"Calque" came to English from French. Since it isn't translated, it's a loanword.

"Loanword" came to English from "Lehnwort " in German, and has been translated.

So...

"Calque" is a loanword.
And "loanword" is a calque.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loanword

1089537851866402816.text:
The reason it's always "yikes!" and never "yike!" is bc yikes is a fifth declension (F) noun. yikes! is the singular and the plural
Singular Plural
yikēs       yikēs
yikeī        yikērum
yikeī        yikēbus
yikem      yikēs
yikē         yikēbus
yikēs       yikēs

1049389279762296833.text:
More progress on a famous problem!

A subset of the plane has "diameter 1" if the distance between any two points in this set is ≤ 1.   An equilateral triangle with edges of length 1 has diameter 1... and it doesn't fit in the circle with diameter 1.

(continued)pic.twitter.com/1NFqUEiotn

1042832087793975297.text:
A Brief History of Philosophy
1. Socrates deletes his account.
2. Plato posts screenshots of Socrates.
3. Aristotle unfollows Plato.
4. Aquinas retweets Jesus.
5. Descartes mutes Aquinas.
6. Locke mutes Descartes.
7. Kant unfollows Locke and Descartes.
8. Hegel subtweets Kant.

1032299901596721152.text:
Me: I don't have time to read lately.
My brain: We should buy more books so we'll read more.

Also me: I haven't had time to play music lately.
My brain: We should buy another instrument so we'll play more.

My brain basically has a single strategy.

Suppose I have a box of jewels. The average value of a jewel in the box is $10. I randomly pull one out of the box. What’s the probability that its value is at least $100?

You can't tell me the exact probability... but you can tell me something about it.
